intro: Cenia debilis, commonly known as the slender cenia, is a small, delicate flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its fragile nature, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
